contest-event.event-date: Sept. 24, 1938 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship An Epic Symphony Alexandra Palace (Concert Room), Alexandra Park, Haringey, Greater London, England, UK Bands were instructed to begin the last movement at figure 25. Note: Henry Geehl was appointed referee. This was the last year that the famous One Thousand Guinea Trophy was presented to the winning band. Prizes: 1st: 50 Pounds 2nd: 40 Pounds and Daily Telegraph Challenge Cup 3rd: 30 Pounds and the W W Grant Memorial Trophy 4th: 25 Pounds 5th: 20 Pounds May 5, 2010, 5:26 p.m. Aug. 28, 2013, 1:29 p.m. 1 Fodens Band Fred Mortimer 2 Bickershaw Colliery William Haydock 3 Black Dyke Band William Halliwell 4 Besses o' th' Barn Willie Wood 5 Blackhall Colliery Noel Thorpe 6 Luton Band Fred Mortimer Unknown Result Westoe Band William Lowes Unknown Result Morris Motors Band Sydney Wood Unknown Result Creswell Colliery Band Harold Moss Unknown Result Baxendale's Works Fred Mortimer Unknown Result Hanwell Band Joseph Crawford Dyson Unknown Result Cooperation Band J.
